apps.name: Zerodha (Kite)
apps.why: Best for serious investors who want control and low costs.
apps.learning_tip: Use 'Varsity' by Zerodha to learn stock basics for free.

apps.name: Groww
apps.why: Super simple interface. Perfect for your first Mutual Fund SIP.
apps.learning_tip: Start with a â‚¹500 SIP in an Index Fund to test the waters.

apps.name: INDmoney
apps.why: Tracks all your family's money in one place. Also allows US investing.
apps.learning_tip: Connect your email to auto-track credit card spends.

apps.name: Jar App
apps.why: Automates savings. Invests your 'chhutte paise' (loose change) into Gold.
apps.learning_tip: Digital Gold is a great way to start saving without feeling the pinch.

apps.name: CRED
apps.why: Rewards you for paying bills. Good for maintaining a high credit score.
apps.learning_tip: Never pay just the 'Minimum Due' on credit cards. Always pay full.

apps.name: ET Money
apps.why: Gives you a 'Portfolio Health Check' report which is very detailed.
apps.learning_tip: Check your 'Portfolio Overlap' to ensure you aren't buying duplicates.

apps.name: FamPay
apps.why: Great for students/teens to manage their own pocket money via UPI.
apps.learning_tip: Learn to budget your monthly allowance before you get a real salary.

apps.name: Jupiter
apps.why: A digital bank that helps you categorize spends into 'Pots'.
apps.learning_tip: Use 'Pots' to save separately for Travel and Gadgets.

apps.name: Uni Cards
apps.why: Split reliable bills into 3 parts. Good for managing cash flow.
apps.learning_tip: Splitting payments is useful, but ensure you have the cashflow for next month.

apps.name: Smallcase
apps.why: Invest in ideas (e.g., 'Electric Vehicles') instead of single stocks.
apps.learning_tip: Thematic investing is riskier than Mutual Funds but safer than single stocks.
